Sure, here are the detailed steps to install the `kcadm.sh` standalone version on Linux:

1. Download the Keycloak server distribution package:
```bash
wget https://downloads.jboss.org/keycloak/15.0.2/keycloak-15.0.2.tar.gz
```
2. Extract the downloaded archive file to a directory of your choice:
```
tar -xzf keycloak-15.0.2.tar.gz
```
3. Navigate to the `bin` directory inside the extracted Keycloak server distribution directory:
```bash
cd keycloak-15.0.2/bin
```
4. Copy the `kcadm.sh` script from the `bin` directory to a directory in your `$PATH` environment variable. For example, you can copy it to `/usr/local/bin`:
```bash
sudo cp kcadm.sh /usr/local/bin
```
This will allow you to run the `kcadm.sh` script from any directory on your Linux box.
5. Set the execute permission on the `kcadm.sh` script:
```bash
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/kcadm.sh
```
6. Test that the `kcadm.sh` script is working properly by running the following command:
```
kcadm.sh version
```
This should output the version of Keycloak that you have installed.

That's it! You have now installed the standalone `kcadm.sh` script on your Linux box. You can use this script to manage Keycloak instances as described in the Keycloak documentation.
